As the best-known film critic in America (and the only one ever to win a Pulitzer), the erstwhile broadcasting partner of Gene Siskel holds a position of unique influence in film.

A retired CIA official and Army officer, Sorley posits a new theory on the Vietnam War: The United States won, but the military victory was immediately undercut by diplomatic backtracking and congressional cowardice.

The WP and LAT fronts report on that nearly $5 million verdict won by actress Hunter Tylo, who sued because she was hired to play a seductress on 'Melrose Place' but was then fired by producer Aaron Spelling's company when it was revealed she was pregnant.
He uses PR brilliantly: Hill and Knowlton tout him relentlessly to reporters and investors, winning him an adulatory profile that serves him well.
